segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, seemingly absorbed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s drying a plate, and I can’t help but admire her focus.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But wait, the sink is overflowing and I wonder how she hasn’t noticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water cascades over the edge like a mini waterfall, pooling on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is right in the puddle, and yet she continues as if nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she’s so unaware, it’s almost frustrating to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden looks so peaceful, contrasting with the chaos indoors.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then I see the boy on the stool, reaching for that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks so unstable; I can’t help but worry he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the girl stands near him with her hand outstretched, waiting eagerly.
segments.speaker: PAR
